The 3 JUnit books on my shelves - all of which I find very useful.

Unit Testing in Java
JUnit in Action
JUnit Recipes

I also have Pragmatic Unit Testing, but I just do not refer to that one as
much. I cannot explain why I do not reach for it, but it usually involves
that JUnit Recipes solves all my reference problems - so I reach there
first.

Out of all of those I would have to say that Unit Testing in Java was my
favorite because it was that book that first made things click for me. It is
well thumbed and annotated like my "Thinking in Java", "Code Complete", and
"Programming Windows 95" books.


Chip

shallow" --George Carlin
